intro: Loxanthocereus erigens, commonly known as the erect night-blooming cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its smooth, pale green stem and spines that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces large, fragrant, white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as bats and moths. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and minimal water. Loxanthocereus erigens is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
